item.title: Mathematical statistics from the basics Random variables
item.description: #Random variables and dice First of all, let’s consider an example of 1 to 6 dice: game_die: which has no distortion. The dice rolls from 1 to 6 are equally likely (there is no bias in their appearance), so the appearance of each die can be given with the following probabilities. $ P (probability of getting 1) = \frac{1}{6}\qquad P (probability of getting 2) = \frac{1}{6}\qquad P (probability of getting 3) = \frac{1}{6}\
